Crossing Class Reference

Describes a crossing and is used to set the turn descriptions and crossin kinds of the connections to the nodes in the crossing. More...

#include <Crossing.h>

Detailed Description

Describes a crossing and is used to set the turn descriptions and crossin kinds of the connections to the nodes in the crossing.

Definition at line 208 of file Crossing.h.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef vector<rbtconn_t> Crossing::rbtconnvector_t [protected]
 

Vector of rbtconn_t structs.

Used to keep track of the exit and entries of a roundabout.

rbtNode The entry node of the rbtconn_t.

float64 Crossing::getAdjustedAngle (  GfxData *  gfx,
bool  isNode0,
bool  printOut = false
)  [static]
 

Get the connecting angle.

This is normaly the angle from the node to the first gfxData point. If the distance to the first point is small and the gfxData makes a sharp turn, the angle between the first and second point is used instead.

Parameters:
gfx The gfxData of the item.
isNode0 True if node 0 is in the crossing.
printOut Set to true if debug printout for this crossing is needed.
Returns:
The angle from north.

bool  isNode0,

)  [protected]
 

Get the two first or last coordinates in one GdfData.

Parameters:
gfx Pointer to the GfxData
isNode0 Shall the position be set for node0 (first coorinate in gfx) or node1 (last coorinate).
lat1 Outparameter. Set to the first latitude.
lon1 Outparameter. Set to the first longitude.
lat2 Outparameter. Set to the second latitude.
lon2 Outparameter. Set to the second longitude.

bool Crossing::getToFerryItemTurndescriptions (  OldNode *  ferryNode,
OldMap *  theMap
)  [static]
 

Sets the turndescriptions to a OldFerryItem node.

Turn descriptions from FItems to SSI are handled by set/getTurnDescriptions().

Parameters:
ferryNode The ferry item to set connections to.
theMap The map on which the ferry item is located.

bool Crossing::getTurnDescriptions (  ObjVector *  conNotices,
bool  rightSideTraffic,
turndescvector_t &  result,
ItemTypes::crossingkind_t &  kind,
StringTable::countryCode  countryCode,
bool  printOut = false
)  [static]
 

Retuens a vector with the turn descripton to the ObjVector with CrossingConnectionElements that is given.

The method is {static} so no Crossing object is needed as no member fields are accessed.

Parameters:
conNotices The connElements of the crossing.
rightSideTraffic Set true if not a leftside country.
result The output result as a vector.
kind The output crossing-kind parameter.
countryCode The countryCode of the map where turn descr are set. If setting turn desc for external conns, give NBR_COUNTRY_CODES as default. Used for deciding certain country specific rules.
printOut Set to true if debug printout for this crossing is needed.
mapID The id of the map used. Only used for debugs.
nodeID The id of one of the nodes in the crossing. Only used for debugs.
Returns:
True if the operation was Ok and the result is correct.

bool Crossing::isPartOfMultidigCrossing (   )  [protected]
 

bool Crossing::isSymetricRoundAbout (  uint32  nodeLength[4],
float64  maxError
)  [protected]
 

Checks if a four-way roundabout is symetric, which means that the exits will be marked right, ahead, and left.

Parameters:
nodeLength A vector with the segment length to each exit.
maxError The maximum allowed error.
Returns:
True if The roundabout is 4-way and symetric.

)  [static, protected]
 

Checks if two name index vectors are the same.(The names of the connections are the same.) Used to deside if two multidigitalized connections are realy the same road.

Returns:
True if same.

byte Crossing::reduceConnections (   )  [protected]
 

Reduces the connection vector by merging multidigitalized connections.

Creates a transfer vector, m_transfV, to link nodes to the connections in the reduced vonnection vector,

Returns:
Number of reductions.

bool Crossing::sameCon (  CrossingConnectionElement *  con1,
CrossingConnectionElement *  con2
)  [protected]
 

Checks if two adjacent multidigitalized crossing connections are realy the same road.

Checks names, angles and entryrestrictions.

Returns:
True if actually the same road.

int Crossing::setRoundAboutConnectionSymmetry (  rbtconnvector_t  connections,
uint32  circumference
)  [protected]
 

Sets the exit count value of the roundabout connections according to the shape of the roundabout.

Parameters:
connections Vector with the connections to/from this roundabout.
circumference The circumference of the roundabout in meters.
Returns:
The number of set exits+entries.

ItemTypes::crossingkind_t Crossing::setRoundaboutCrossingKind (  OldNode *  endNode,
int &  exits,
int  calls,
uint32  nodeLength[4],
int32 &  distance,
rbtconnvector_t &  conns,
bool  backward = false
)  [protected]
 

bool Crossing::setRoundaboutCrossingKind (   ) 
 

bool Crossing::setTurnDescriptions (   ) 
 

Sets turnDescriptions and crossing kind for all connections in the crossing.

Even the turns that might be illegal are described. Crossing kind roundabout crossings are set to UNDEFINED_CROSSING and needs to be set by setRoundaboutCrossingKind(). (Uses getTurnDescriptions() and sets the result to member fields.)

Returns:
False if the Crossing only contains one node.

The vector of crossing connections elements leading to the crossing.

Sorted clockwise.
